thread.title: Morris football blanks LaSalle-Peru in finale
thread.title_full: Morris football blanks LaSalle-Peru in finale

title: Morris football blanks LaSalle-Peru in finale
text:
Morris football blanks LaSalle-Peru in finale Published: Friday, Oct. 23, 2015 11:37 p.m. CDT • Updated: Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 2:11 a.m. CDT Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Michael Gerischer ran for 83 yards and a touchdown in Morris' 40-0 win over LaSalle-Peru on Friday night. Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Morris' Austin Dearing intercepts a pass in the first quarter of the Redskins' 40-0 win over LaSalle-Peru on Friday night. Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Morris' Keagan Sobol breaks free for a 22-yard touchdown run in the first quarter of the Redskins' 40-0 win over LaSalle-Peru on Friday night. Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Delaney Stutzki hauls in a pass that turned into a 40-yard touchdown in a 40-0 win over LaSalle-Peru on Friday night. By ROB OESTERLE - roesterle@shawmedia.com 
LASALLE — After a steady rain during most of the sophomore game Friday night, the Morris football team used a steady diet of running plays to cruise past LaSalle-Peru, 40-0, and finish the season with a 4-5 record. 
After Austin Dearing intercepted an L-P pass at the Morris 28, the Redskins went 72 yards on eight plays, all runs, with Keagan Sobol finishing the drive with a 22-yard scoring burst through the middle. Sobol led the Redskins with 103 yards and two touchdowns on nine carries, while Michael Gerischer had 83 yards and a touchdown on 12 attempts. 
Junior quarterback Ricky Del Favero got his first start and completed 2 of 3 passes for 58 yards and two touchdowns, one a 40-yarder to Delaney Stutzki and the other an 18-yarder to Jake Webb. Del Favero also ran four times for 26 yards and a touchdown. 
The Redskin defense also ended the season on a high note, coming up with the shutout. In fact, if it weren't for a 75-yard pass by LaSalle-Peru's Kennedy Carey to Ryan McManus on the Cavaliers' final drive, Morris would have limited L-P to negative yards. As it was, the long pass got L-P to the Morris 11, but the Redskin defense did not allow them to score.
